objectives: Critically evaluate scholarly perspectives on game theory

multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about game theory
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about game theory
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of game theory
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to game theory
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about game theory
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss game theory
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to game theory
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to game theory

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about game theory
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about game theory
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about game theory

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Quiet study area with writing materials and references

warm_up.description: Students write quick responses about game theory
warm_up.materials: Paper and pens or digital writing tools

main_activities.description: Students receive information about game theory through reading_writing modality
Students practice language related to game theory using reading_writing approach
Students produce original content about game theory demonstrating advanced thinking

discussion_prompts: What are the implications of game theory for society?
How would you design a better approach to game theory?
What criteria would you use to evaluate game theory?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for game theory
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to game theory

homework_options.required: Core assignment at advanced level using reading_writing approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about game theory
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
